The Indianapolis Colts have once again cut journeyman quarterback Josh Johnson on Monday, pointing toward the potential return of Andrew Luck for Sunday night's matchup with the New England Patriots. 
In addition, the Colts added free agent return specialist Marcus Thigpen to the squad. 
The Indianapolis Colts added former Buffalo Bills return specialist Marcus Thigpen on Monday. (Photo: Kirby Lee / USA Today Sports) 
Thigpen, who played at Indiana University from 2004-08, spent the first four weeks of the 2015 NFL season with the Buffalo Bills. The 5-9, 200-pound return man averaged 5.2 yards on nine punt returns and 9.7 yards on three kick returns for the Bills. 
Prior to his run in Buffalo, Thigpen handled returns for Tampa Bay, New England and Miami. Thigpen holds a career average of 10 yards per punt return with two touchdowns and 24.2 yards on kick returns with a touchdown. 
As for Johnson, his run with Colts lasted two games where he was active but did not play. The 2008 fifth-round pick has spent time with San Francisco, Cincinnati, Cleveland and Tampa Bay before his brief stint with the Colts.
